name: The Quadrant Hotel and Suites Auckland

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We really enjoyed our stay at the Quadrant.
reviews.title: A very good choice for Auckland

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It has nice, modern large and clean rooms as well as a good location close to all downtown spots to see. We had booked for a 1-bedroom suite and got an upgrade to a 2-bedroom, room 2005.
reviews.title: Comfortable say with everything we needed.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service is not exactly there (no help for luggage, front desk staff always fully busy), but it did not matter because we had everything we needed.
reviews.title: Trendy, but affordable hotel in Auckland

reviews.text: A nice touch: the music/video played in the elevators. A very good way to promote local bands.
reviews.title: Great deal...just don't book through the hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was wonderful to receive the warm, friendly greeting when we arrived at this hotel after more than 40 hours spent traveling in planes and airports.
reviews.title: A Lovely Place

reviews.text: We booked the Quadrant through a travel website and so received a special deal - stay 3 nights and get the 4th free, which brought it down into our price range.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have to say I was very happy with the Quadrant. The rooms were nice, the beds comfy, housekeeping was regular, the location was great and we even had a bit of a view, and the noise factor wasn't too bad.
reviews.title: Excellent facilities and quiet room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only issue was the only way to park there was to pay for Valet parking - which added to the cost a bit, but which at least took the hassle off finding a carpark.
reviews.title: OH SO VERY HANDY TO VECTOR ARENA

reviews.text: We have really enjoyed our 5 nights at the Quadrant Hotel. It is in easy walking distance to everywhere. I was particularly pleased to beable to pay extra to use the wonderful spa facilities in the hotel next door, their 25 metre pool was wonderful. The cooking faciilities meant that we were able to make our own breakfasts and drinks. It was very useful to have a washing machine.
reviews.title: Great value for money, location and Hip place

reviews.text: We changed rooms on arrival to have a room with a view of the harbour. Being on floor 19 meant we had a fantastic outlook over te city, the Domain and the ocean.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay in Auckland

reviews.text: Hotel was as expected for 4* hotel in inner city location. Rooms were clean and tidy and reasonable well equipped. We stayed in a 2 bedroom room which was quite small with the 2nd bedroom being a movable walled off corner of the living area. Views from the balcony over the harbour. Only complaint was after a 14hr flight which arrived early in the morning, attempted to check-in at 12pm but the room was not available, returned at the stated check-in time of 3pm but the room was still not available, eventually got room at 4:30pm
reviews.title: Reasonable value hotel in good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hi,
reviews.title: Superb Accommodation at Superb Rates

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was on a vacation to New Zealand & stayed at The Quadrant for 2 days. Amazing Hotel, neat & clean. I had booked a Studio Apartment, Room was great with all the basic amenities. Balcony had a sound proof glass so super silence in the room. Had a sea view from the balcony. Will surely return to the Hotel. Keep up the good work.
reviews.title: Efficient with value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is free WiFi in each room, which I didn't get any any other hotel in New Zealand. The only thing not available was Free Parking. It was 28NZD for a Night. Free parking is available on the street across, but only from 6PM - 7AM.
reviews.title: This is perfect for a pause.
Good hotel to "lay your weary head"
reviews.text: This hotel was a real find. Rooms were compact but did include washing machine, fridge/freezer and dining table plus desk. Staff were extremely friendly and helpful.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel rooms/apartments are nice and spacious. However, the location of the hotel is on a steep hill, which means that if you're coming back from the city centre you have to climb it (really hard). It's OK if you have a car, or you don't mind taking taxi's. Another option is to take the tourist bus that stops near by, but it's not that frequent and you have to wait and wait... so, FYI.
reviews.title: Nice rooms, but located on a steep hill

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service at this hotel could use improvement. They made many efforts to be accommodating but were often stretched too thin. We often waited for our car to be brought up by the valet because they were too busy. We also waited so long for our luggage to be brought up to our room (as they insisted) that we went down and brought it up ourselves. The cleaning staff were friendly, but mis-took several of our items for garbage (wine luggage box, razor case) and threw them out and the hotel never replaced them.
reviews.title: Trendy hotel up a hill, Short staffed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room had everything we needed but it was small. The bathroom was especially cramped.
reviews.title: Off the charts FANTASTIC!!

reviews.text: The location is very close to the port and other nice villages - although is located on a steep hill. We enjoyed the hot tub but the gym was very small. Breakfast was not included and was a fortune.
reviews.title: Offensive. Disgusting.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We liked the location and the style of the hotel but were always nervous to approach the front desk incase they were in a bad mood.
reviews.title: great place to stay

aka: The Quadrant Hotel And Suites Auckland New Zealand
description: Located in downtown Auckland, just a well shod hop, skip and jump away from the city's fashion district, restaurants and bars - featuring 200 apartment style rooms (studios, 1 and 2 bedroom apartments) each with a fully equipped kitchen, balcony and FREE Wifi with a generous daily limit of 1GB. It's easy to see why The Quadrant Hotel becomes the home away from home for many travellers throughout the year.
